Position & Orbit

Mercury is the smallest and innermost planet in the Solar System. Its orbital period around the Sun of 87.97 days is the shortest of all the planets in the Solar System.

Planet Info

Venus is the second planet from the Sun, orbiting it every 224.7 Earth days.

Planet Info

Earth is the third planet from the Sun and the only astronomical object known to harbor life. Earth orbits around the Sun in 365.26 days, a period known as an Earth year.

Planet Info

Mars is the fourth planet from the Sun and the second-smallest planet in the Solar System after Mercury. Its' orbital period is 687 (Earth) days.

Planet Info

Jupiter is the fifth planet from the Sun and the largest in the Solar System. It completes an orbit every 11.86 years.

Planet Info

Saturn is the sixth planet from the Sun and the second-largest in the Solar System, after Jupiter. It takes Saturn 10,759 Earth days (or about ​29 1⁄2 years)[71] to finish one revolution around the Sun.

Planet Info

Uranus is the seventh planet from the Sun. Uranus orbits the Sun once every 84 years.

Planet Info

Neptune is the eighth and farthest known planet from the Sun in the Solar System. It completes an orbit on average every 164.79 years.
